title: Flight drops 10,000 feet before making an emergency landing - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Flight drops 10,000 feet before making an emergency landing Published on : Monday, August 10, 2015
What passengers described as scary, a United Express flight dropped almost 10,000 feet due to a problem with the cabin pressure before making an emergency landing in Indianapolis on Sunday. The Embraer 145 was scheduled to fly from Charlotte to Chicago and is arguably the second U.S. commercial flight to make an emergency landing within a span of two days.
The pilot of the United Express Flight 5919 followed the apt procedure according to the reports. However, some of the airline passengers complained of headaches and ear problems and were attended by medical responders as soon as the plane landed.
There were about 50 passengers on board the United Express flight operated by ExpressJet. The passengers were later transferred to Chicago on a bus â€“ a three hour drive from Indianapolis.
The incident took place within a span of two days after a Delta Air Lines flight had to make an emergency landing following a cracked windshield. The flight flew into a storm and was hit by hail and lightning. The Delta flight made a safe landing at Denver International Airport.
